name: Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the old tower.This is a poorly remodeled 60's hotel with tiny rooms and even tinier bathroom with a narrow stall shower. There is a lot of street noise that comes into the room. On the plus side, the location is suberb, close to the beach and shopping. Parking is expensive. Marriott did not represent the hotel accurately on their website, and we would not stay here again.
reviews.title: One-Star hotel in 5-Star Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would not recommend to stay in the rooms overlooking Lewers St as they are extremely noisy. If it's not the noise from the bar right opposite, then its the drunks after 2am..followed by the tour & airport buses from 5am. Basically you can not sleep at all.They should double-glaze the windows and balconies on that side.
reviews.title: Very noisy 24/7

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll start with the good 'cos there's not many: 3 fast computers in lobby with free internet access; 3 slow ones. Printer available for unlimited use. Walk to Waikiki Beach is about 8 minutes. Most staff members are nice.
reviews.title: 3rd World Country living standards in Modern Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bad stuff: As a guest having to pay for Car Parking is ridiculous. Were were not notified in advance during booking. Unpleasant surprise of $29 per day, plus about US$2 tip upon leaving in the morning and another US$2 tip upon returning in the evening. We stayed here 10 nights, that would work out to be $330 plus 4.71% tax !!! Thankfully we spoke with another guy who told us across the road Ohana charges $20 per day no tips, self park. NO choice here at Courtyard Marriott for Self-Parking ... Half the stay, hand towels, face towels were stained yellow...One side of the bed, Lamp not working ... TV not working ... Phone "SPKR" turns on in the middle of the night twice, thought it was a ghost ! ... Room so small we spent considerable time trying to put our Standard Check-In Luggages x2 and Cabin Luggages x2 ... Powerpoints difficult to access and not enough ... CLEANER NOT CONSISTENT - some days no Tea Coffee, other days, no spare Toilet Paper and existing tiny roll not replaced! ... Noisy old Air Conditioning system hole in wall with limited controls to only AUTO, we ended up turning it off when we slept waking up sweating ... Breakfast Voucher a LIE, front desk told us it's a seminar similar to Timeshare so we didn't claim it ...Valet Parking staff not friendly ... Toilet Flushing is VERY LOUD, can hear neighbours flushing too ! Not good if you're a light sleeper ... Shower is so small only a skinny malnutritioned person can fit in ... Things falling apart ... WOULD NEVER COME BACK unless they renovate and expand this place. NOT WORTH THE MONEY. If we didn't pre-pay, we would have moved after the first night. Lots of Aussies here too. Must be some sort of Travel Agent commission deal offered.
reviews.title: Avoid this establishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: My perspective I choose to write based upon facts which were captured to descrive a persective of a negative stay:
reviews.title: Good local small rooms
Convenient Location, Decent Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is centrally located in Honolulu, not far from the Royal Hawaiian. The main shopping strip, Kalakaua Ave (Gucci, Tiffany, Ugg, etc.) is 3 blocks away, Waikiki Beach 4 blocks away. The lobby has been handsomely updated- quite modern and chic. The rooms, while small, are quite clean and comfortable. The pool and jacuzzi are not large and in shade most of the day. The street noise can be a bit much, but the windows were quite soundproof. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.

reviews.title: smart[--] "service" from immature team
reviews.text: Excellent location, great spot to explore waikiki. All else needs an overhaul starting with stupidity of the behaviour of staff.

reviews.title: Most convenient place in Waikiki
reviews.text: Arrived at 10am with 2 other families after an 11 hr flight. Checking in side by side, we were fed a load of verbal dioarrhea and told to come back at 3pm for our room. The other families were checked in immediately and taken to their rooms. We sucked it up, and waited in good faith. Came back at 1pm to be given 1 room, and still waiting for the second room. Front end team continued to play lots of other silly games which I wont bore you with, but be warned. Eventually we insisted on seeing the operations manager, and rooms were resolved, but there is no reason for us to have to work ourselves up into such an emotionally distressed state and put up with the myriad of disrespectful "gestures" of customer service from staff. Would not go back here, and if we were staying longer- would have moved hotels. Book somewhere else and have a relaxing holiday!

reviews.title: Good Location!
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located right in the heart of Waikiki. Everything is virtually at arms' length and TheBus (by route number) which stops at your doorstep, can bring you anywhere. And if you're on a really tight budget you can also take the bus (#19 and 20) to and from the airport. The hotel is not a 4 or 5-star hotel but neither does it pretend to be. What it is , is a well-run 3 1/2-star hotel that gives you more than what you pay for. It is clean, pleasant, pleasantly staffed, efficient and convenient. I would not hesitate to stay there again given the chance. I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: A good value
reviews.text: We stayed in the main tower, the one where you check in. The room was pretty big (two queens) and the so was the bathroom. With all the space it had, they should have put in a tub. Anyway, the hotel is in a good location and you can definitely walk to the beach, shopping, eating and drinking areas that are popular in Waikiki.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a travel photographer I have stayed at many many hotels of all standards around the world - and the Wyland has to be one of the best. It is exactly as it says it is : Excellent value for money - good location and lovely clean rooms/bathroom etc. The rooms are small but the foyer has several areas you can relax in, plus the chill room. Highly recommend this hotel - especially if there is just two of you, looking for a great stress free holiday. Only negative was the air-con noise - but you can't sleep without it!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there in this hotel for 5 nights and it was an excellent place. Very good room service and reasonably priced restaurants around. Beach is at a good 5 min walk and hotel is located at the prime spot . Hotel is well maintained and above all, room rates are very very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great Place!
Good for the price
reviews.text: No complaints at all..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from Hawaii. We stayed for three nights. Overall it was fine for the price. We thought Fernando at the front desk was great. The bell men and valets were also super. The property was clean and neat. We booked a partial ocean and our room was right over Kuhio and therefore really loud. Even with the door closed and air conditioning on I felt like we were in Manhattan. The next morning we were moved to a one bedroom suite in an adjacent building. The room was very nice and much quieter. However, we were next to a group of 6-8 smokers/partiers who squeezed into their room. The second night we called the front desk at midnight and the group quieted down by 1 am. They also smoked on the lanai (and in the room) so we could smell the smoke right away. We alerted the security who would check, they would stop, and then start again. Perhaps the low summer rates are attracting a less than desirable crowd. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind a walk to the beach and are on a budget. The pool and the employees were great. The beds are very comfortable.
reviews.title: I loved it and we're going again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days starting Sept 5th. Once we drove up to the property we were taken away. It is very clean and the guys in valet were helpful with places to eat and other pieces of information from the time we arrived until the day we left. We stayed in room 311 which overlooked the street of Kuhio. We had a kitchenette, a seperate living area (which turned out to be a sofabed) and bedroom. There were sliding doors in both the living area and bedroom that led to the balcony of course with table and chairs...(which we enjoyed during the early, early morning hours).
reviews.title: Very tastefully renovated

likes.disliked: — Size of the room and the air conditioner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed six days at the Wyland Waikiki. The location is very good for what we paid - $109 per night. On the map, it didn't look close to the beach, but it's only about two blocks from Kuhio Ave. (Wyland is on the corner of Royal Hawaiian and Kuhio) to Kalakaua Ave. From there you can go between the two Sheratons or go down Kalakau past the hotels. I also went down Lewers (back of the hotel) to Kalia and found beach access, too. I also found inexpensive rentals of umbrellas and chairs. (By the way, the Army Museum at the corner of Kalia and Saratoga is fascinating.)
reviews.title: We Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are the great things about the Wyland: the Chill Room, the salt water pool (very warm and wonderful), the helpful staff, the decor the flat screen TV, the free wi-fi. The room was very nice but very small. The bathroom was like a cruise ship bathroom - just a small shower stall. We usually opt to reuse towels but couldn't because there was only one tiny rack to hang them on so they stayed wet. And no robe hook! Nice amenities, though - shampoo, conditioner, hand cream, shower gel, good soaps.
reviews.title: Best Service, Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We opted for the 14th floor to avoid noise but some nights Kuhio Ave. is very busy, especially Saturday night. We couldn't believe that the noise could be so loud that high up. But other nights were extremely quiet. We rarely heard noise from the other guests.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Wyland for Thanksgiving 08

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We didn't bring the laptop and there were two computers for guests use. It was never a problem - people were very good about limiting their use to 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Very nice appearance, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009
reviews.text: The location is good - quite close to Kalakaua Ave without the high price. We were able to walk from one end of Waikiki to the other easily.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending a week at Turtle Bay Resort, spent 3 nights at Wyland (City View room with kitchenette) to do some shopping before flying back to Sydney. Top marks for the decor both in the rooms and public areas. The 2 plasma TVs in the room was an added bonus. Hotel is convenient to public transport, the beach and shopping precincts.
reviews.title: Loved Wyland Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommend Spada Restaurant on the premises for dinner, staff friendly and accommodating. Continental breakfast at Kimobean in the morning was convenient and they made a great cafe latte as well.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked the hotel online so was a little concerned, but was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel upon arrival. An oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. My husband and I felt like we were on the North Shore instead of downtown Waikiki.
reviews.title: Well Done Wyland!

likes.disliked: — the restaurant spada, no stovetops in kitchenettes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the place!
reviews.title: wyland was just our style
do not eat at spada !!
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. They provide a breakfast, including a drink and pastry/bagel at the coffee shop in the lobby. The decor is simple with clean lines and includes artwork by Wyland. It is a five-minute walk from the beach. Our room had a balcony with two chairs and a table which looked out over the city. Staff was very kind and helpful. Our check-out time was three hours before we needed to leave for the airport, and they were happy to hold our luggage for us for that time.

reviews.title: One of the best
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent 16 wonderful days in Waikiki at the Wyland Hotel and would return in the wink of an eye. We chose this hotel after having read many critiques on Tripadvisor. The only negative point: we had to come back to Canada after 16 days.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great price
reviews.text: This hotel has been recently renovated and is extremely clean. Every single person at the reception that we spoke to was extremely gracious and did his or her very best to assist us. Moreover, we found most of the people working in this hotel to be in a happy mood and their facial expression certainly showed this.

reviews.title: Great Stay at Wyland
reviews.text: Our bedroom was quite small (see pictures) but we knew this before leaving for Hawaii. We just slept there and didn't expect a gameroom. We were given a room on the 15th floor and contrary to what I read, there was very little noise.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The beach is just a short walk away and there are all kinds of restaurants nearby. There is also one at this hotel.

reviews.title: I want to be back there!
reviews.text: We booked this hotel when they had a every third night free, free breakfast, free upgrade promo. We went, expecting an upgrade from the smallest room, to the second smallest (the standard to the superioe). When we got there, they upgraded us to a kitchenette, which was huge, had a microwave, fridge, extra sink, table and chairs inside the room and 2 double beds. The only downside to this room is that it was on the forth floor and faced both the road and the pool. I'm a very light sleeped and I expected the noise from the road to bother me, but it wasn't that bad. The noise from the waterfalls around the pool masked any road noise, although there was no way we could sleep with the balcony door or air conditioning on. The noise on Kuhio St is not nearly as bad as the noise on the street closer to the beach where all the entertainement etc goes on way into the night. The breakfast in the coffee shop is not great. I'm not a coffee drinker at all, so I just got bottled water and either a muffin or bagle each day. The hotel is really only a 5 min walk to the beach, 10 if you walk really slow. We didn't spend much time in waikiki anyways, and took advantage of the parking at the hotel for our rental car (18 dollars a day to park at the hotel, which is cheaper than many of the other hotels that we looked at). We did take a look at the regular sized rooms to see how small they really are, they are tiny, but comfortable. You don't spend much time at the hotel anyways while you're in hawaii. The pool is freezing when it is shady, but not bad if the sun is out. The hot tub is good. The staff at the hotel are very helpful as well and gave us lots of tips.

reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location
reviews.text: After much serching through all the hotels in the Waikiki area, we settled on the Wyland Waikiki. It was The Best! Excellent value for your money! Front desk Hosts were fast, fun and friendly. We were greeted with a smile and they happily granted my request for the highest floor available (which was the one below the penthouse! Upgrade for free!). The room was so clean and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever had in a motel. Room was a bit smaller than most, but it was a perfect size for the two of us. Great restaurant there in the "Spada". Had breakfast and dinner there and was very satisfied with both meals. Waitstaff was very friendly and courteous. This hotel was in a perfect location if you don't have a car. The public bus stop was right out the front door. The number 42 bus takes you to the Marina in about 15 minutes and to Pearl Harbor in a little over an hour. Only $2.00 a ride. Then a half block walk to board the Trolley or be picked up for the Circle Tour. About 5 minutes to Waikiki Beach, and two blocks to Kalakaua Ave., which is the "5th Avenue" or "Michigan Street" of Honolulu. A great selection of shopping and restaurants are all within 10 minutes of walking. I would recommend getting a "GoOahu" Card. Review the website and see if those are the things you are going to be doing while here. It will save you a lot of money. I would stay here again!

reviews.title: Best vacation
reviews.text: After many weeks of preparation we finally decided on the Wyland. What a great place to stay! The rooms were very clean and even though we had read that they were small we found them to be plenty large for 2 people. All the room we needed for two weeks in eden. Check in was easy as was check out. The chill room was incredible! Great massage! Free calls to Canada for the first 15 min. was a great saving also. All in all this was the best vacation we have been on yet and hope we can return in the future. Aloha and mahalo!! From P.E.I. Canada!!!

reviews.title: Wyland Waikiki, one of Hawaii's beautiful treasures.
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and found it to be very beautiful. Looking around at all the marine life depicted in art and sculpture really made me feel like I was staying somewhere very luxurious. The ammenities that this hotel offers were great as well. Free internet & printing access for guests in the lobby with plush couches set all around made me feel really relaxed just hanging around the hotel instead of seeking refuge in my room like I have done at some hotels. The massage chairs in the lobby were to die for as well. The only complaints that I have about this hotel at all are about the size of the room we stayed in, but I realize that this is a smaller boutique hotel and for the price value it was well worth it and I would do it again. The bathroom is teeny tiny and the space between the twin beds that we had was very small. Disclaimer: I am a plus sized person however, so this may not be the case for everyone. If you book here, I would highly recommend getting a room with 1 bed instead of the 2.

reviews.title: We loved the Wyland!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Wyland from March 6-12. We arrived around 4:30 p.m. The hotel looked very nice! It has a contemporary vibe, which is just our style. :)

reviews.title: Special Perks Makes Wyland a Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: We booked a standard room (through Orbitz) and got a free upgrade to the Deluxe Kitchenette w/king size bed. We read that the rooms were small and we were pleasantly surprised. It wasn't as small as we imagined it would be. It was actually pretty spacious. Our room was on the 8th floor, facing the pool. We didn't have any problems with street noise or neighbors making noise. The AC was a little loud, but we didn't mind. There is a safe in the closet. It was large enough to fit my 13" Macbook. The rooms have wired internet for free or you can use the iMac's downstairs (w/free printing!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I reserved 2 rooms at the Wyland for me and some traveling companions. My friends arrived at the hotel before I did and were not allowed to check into their room, even though I had called prior to arrival and requested that they be allowed to check in without me. In the end, due to flight delays on my end, they waited over 7 hours in the lobby of the hotel. For any traveler from the mainland, that is too long to wait when the room is available.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not the best service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Then, they tried to upsell us into suites. I think they should have provided them with a suite at no additional charge.
reviews.title: Great place to stay if you don't care about being beachside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, our 3rd floor rooms did have lots of street noise, but we were so tired, it really didn't matter.
reviews.title: Nice concept...Staff needs ALOT of work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is filled with a lot of Wyland art so very picturesque but is not beachside. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the beach depending on traffic. But unlike a lot of hotels in Waikiki that depend on people going to the beach, this hotel has a very nice pool and jacuzzi. It's never too crowded and you can always get a lounge chair by the pool. There is internet in the rooms and even a fridge. The staff were very friendly and the room was great with a very large TV and a balcony on both sides. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable but very little soundproofing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (3rd night free deal) and feel that this is more than long enough. The building it self is obviously an older building that was renovated with new paint, fixtures and furniture. It was done well with what they had to work with and we loved all the Wyland art that was around. I think our favorite part of the hotel was the fact that we were on the 16th floor of the main building and each floor had a different huge Wyland piece hung so that it would be the first thing you see when the doors to the elevator opened. We had fun trying to guess which floor had which painting on it. Anyway, while that was fun, I don't think that it should have been the best part of our stay there.
reviews.title: Every single staff member of every department of this hotel are awsome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: We were in Hawaii for 2 weeks and wanted a cheaper accom for the first half of the trip so we could splurge on our accom during the 2nd half of the trip - so we chose the Courtyard Marriott for our cheaper accom. It is fair value i.e. you do get what you pay for. Very small and basic room & shower. 5 min walk to the beach, and bus stop to Ala Moana and Diamond Head was right in front of our hotel. Cleanliness level is average, carpets felt like they could use a clean and hair dryer was a bit sticky - otherwise ok. Concierge was excellent - very helpful and knowledgeable. Check in was a very smooth process. Free wifi was very handy, but was only available in the lobby and not our room. We could also use the computers and printer in the lobby for free. Overall it was an OK experience and we were quite satisfied, but if I am ever after a hotel in this price range in future when I go back to Waikiki, I would probably try something different.
reviews.title: Basic and functional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a horrible experience! I got in late, the man at the front desk was rude. As he check me in he didn't give any eye contact. So after a long flight from Atlanta I was greeted with rudeness. I am a Marriott Rewards member and stay with them for both work and pleasure. I travel 3 weeks out of a month, and have only had one other similar experience. I checked out and went over to the Hilton resort. It was great! I am going for my 2012 travel I am going back to the Hilton. If you stay in Hawaii, stay at the Hilton Resort. The rooms are larger and the staff is considerably nicer.
reviews.title: Bad Bad Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made last minute arrangements to stay at the Marriott Courtyard in Waikiki for an overnight following a cruise of the Hawaiian Islands. We should have searched a bit harder but decided that this was the Marriott brand so it soudl be good. Our check-in was efficient and the room clean but small. We liked the bed - very comfortable and had no problems with noise from other rooms. We would definately stay here again in a pinch but could probably find better value for the money at a hotel closer to the beach.
reviews.title: Nice bed, good service, small room not a great price or best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time I have ever left a review of a hotel. We returned from a great 6 night trip yesterday. The hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance to everything. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. After reading reviews, I was a little bit concerned. I did take 2 tips and prerequested a higher floor and one facing the pool, rather than the street. My requests were honored and our room was in the main building. We did have a larger room #1504; but not a suite and there was more than enough room for 2 people. We had a nice view of the mountains. My husband is very fussy when it comes to hotels, due to traveling a lot. He had no complaints and said he would stay here again. I was not thrilled about paying $25 a night to park; but the parking attendants were great and it was well worth the cost for the convenience. We did not experience problems such as slow elevators or noisy A/C. Yes, the shower is a little small; but this was not an issue. This was a great choice for a place to stay.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read the reviews on the hotel before I booked and thought some were being too picky. Being a loyal Marriott traveller ,I used my points for a week stay in November and requested a larger room overlooking the pool. As a loyal guest you would think that my request would be honoured, however after a long flight we were given a very tiny room. I went to the front desk to complain and were told they were all full and that I had received a large room.(not the case) The next day we were given a different room that was overlooking the pool. Much better but still on the small side.
reviews.title: Tiny Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a short trip to hawaii, we arrived and our room had ovbiously been overbooked, as they could only put us in a single bed room. We got moved the next day, thankgod.
reviews.title: Original and a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are very small but very clean and nice decor. The hotel is very lovely and original - like the arty aspect. Location is great - close to the beach and shops.
reviews.title: Not Good, Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were a little unhelpful - no introduction to the hotel and facilities, and the only real pain was that they didnt serve breakfast, there is a shop that serves coffee and bagels, but nothing like cereal and a nice sit down for breakfast. Would be nice if they started doing this!!!!
reviews.title: wow - we were impressed with the wyland waikiki
Beautiful and Modern
reviews.text: Ihop is across the road if you can manage to eat HUGE MEALS, I recommend sharing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were on the 14 and 16 floor and you can definately hear the pool and street noise - garbage trucks at 4.00am in the morning.
reviews.title: Perfect Hawaiian Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We try to stay loyal to Marriott properties when we can. On our trip to Honolulu we debated between the Marriott and the Courtyard and chose the Courtyard because we preferred a king and a sofabed configuration. The location is fine. The staff is very nice. The valets were especially helpful. We were conflicted about tipping them and decided not to due to the $25 daily parking charge. We hope we didn't make a grave error on this. The lobby is sleek and modern. The lobby bar always had customers having a good time. The real issue for us was the window air conditioners. Our suite had two units. The one in the living room stopped working part way through our stay and the one in our room wouldn't turn off. It was so loud my husband and I couldn't have a conversation from opposite sides of the bed. The only blessing is that the loud a/c drowned out the street noise. The beds were comfortable which was a plus. Overall, this property needs to update the a/c to the rooms and update the rooms a bit more. As for location, service and price, it was good.
reviews.title: Stayed loyal to Marriott but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Basic 3 star. Great location. The Expedia desk reps in the hotel are extremely resourceful. They saved me about $150 on a car rental. The rooms are very small. They all have a nice balcony. Get a room facing the beachside so that you get sun in the afternoon. The pool is a waste of space. Very small and doesn't get much sun at all. Parking is expensive. You can park by the canal for free but just read the signs as there is street sweeping on certain days of the week and your car will get towed if you leave it there during these times. You can also park at a meter between 6pm and 7am for free otherwise it's $1.50 per hour. There are lots of options in the area for the same price range. This hotel is nothing spectacular.
reviews.title: Standard 3 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros - staff was good, location. Cons - noisy, not clean, not well maintained and the air did not work. Not what one would expect out of a Marriott. Should have known better for the price in Honolulu. Will not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not up to standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: i like this place because if i dont want to drag a computer to hawaii they have 4 you can use for FREE in the lobby. the rooms are typical marriott decorated and not overly large but they have a refrigerator as well as a microwave. this place has a nice pool and hot tub and a quaint little bar. for the money a jgood buy
reviews.title: fairly inexpensive and near the heart of stuff in waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I almost always stay at a Marriott, usually at a Residence Inn since I like to have a full kitchen. I thought that Marriott usually had a high standard since I am very picky about where I lie down to sleep every night.
reviews.title: Feels like staying at a cheap motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into the Wyland Waikiki on a day rate. Our flight didn't leave until 11.15pm at night and the hotel we were staying at was going to charge us $120 for a late check out at 6pm. The Wyland did a day rate from 7am to 10pm for $110 which was much better value.
reviews.title: Perfect for day stay

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable with a great pool
likes.disliked: — Very small room and loud A/C

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was really easy and it was the first time we were asked for some photo id. Security is really good as nobody can use the lifts without swiping their room key card. We were given a map of Waikiki and a coupon book for restaurant discounts. There is lots of really nice art around the lobby, hallways, rooms and in the grounds.
reviews.title: Thoroughly reccommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (Room 614) was small but comfortable and clean with a small lanai overlooking a pool. Not much room for storing luggage. Coffee and tea were available in the room and it was the first time we struck a hotel that offered free local calls. The bathroom was really tiny but the shower was one of the best we had come across and I really loved the shaving mirror (great for putting on make up when you are short sighted). The A/C was really, really loud and when we had an afternoon nap, we had to turn it off and open the sliding door for some quiet.
reviews.title: ALOHA!!! IT WAS GREAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent most of the day around the pool and spa area which was really attractive with a lovely waterfall and dolphin feature. Plenty of towels, sun loungers, chairs, and complementary frozen ices (Otter Pops?) in a freezer in the pool area. We found out from another guest that there was a larger pool but we were happy where we were. There was a small cafe located just off the lobby and a bar near the bar area. There also appeared to be an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel.
reviews.title: Worst hotel on our trip
